text:
(1)
Water Street, west from (No. 494) but not including Rutgers Slip, showing a lumber yard and scrap iron dump on the north side of the street (right) occupying the area from No. 504 (not shown) to 486 (6-story building). Also shown is a portion of the Manhattan Bridge.
March 22, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A more limited view of No. 1, extending only to Pike Slip, but showing the lumber yard in its entirety.
March 22, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
A detail of view No. 2, showing the area from No. 496 to 500, the scrap-iron dump.
March 22, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: Water Street - Rutgers Slip
